Uses of Class
org.security.crypt.symmetric.SymmetricAlgorithm

  • Packages that use SymmetricAlgorithm 
    Package Description
    org.security.crypt.pbe
    This package contains classes to implement Password Based Encryption (PBE).
    org.security.crypt.pkcs
    This package contains classes to implement Public-Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS)
    org.security.crypt.symmetric
    This package contains classes to implement symmetric algorithms viz, AES, DES, DESede, RC, CAST, Rijndael Twofish, etc.

    • Uses of SymmetricAlgorithm in org.security.crypt.pbe

      Creates a new instance with the given parameters.

      Creates a new instance with the given parameters.
      PKCS12EncryptionScheme(SymmetricAlgorithm alg, DigestAlgorithm digest, PBEParameter params, int keyBitLength)
      Creates a new instance with the given parameters.

    • Uses of SymmetricAlgorithm in org.security.crypt.pkcs

      Methods in org.security.crypt.pkcs that return SymmetricAlgorithm 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SymmetricAlgorithm PBES2CipherGenerator.generate()
      Generates a symmetric cipher algorithm from decoded state data.

      Methods in org.security.crypt.symmetric that return SymmetricAlgorithm 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static SymmetricAlgorithm SymmetricAlgorithm.newInstance(AlgorithmSpec spec)
      Creates a new instance from an algorithm specification.
      static SymmetricAlgorithm SymmetricAlgorithm.newInstance(AlgorithmSpec spec, java.security.spec.AlgorithmParameterSpec cipherSpec)
      Creates a new instance from an algorithm specification and cipher initialization parameters.
      static SymmetricAlgorithm SymmetricAlgorithm.newInstance(java.lang.String cipherAlgorithm)
      Creates a new instance that uses a cipher of the given algorithm and the default mode and padding.
      static SymmetricAlgorithm SymmetricAlgorithm.newInstance(java.lang.String cipherAlgorithm, java.lang.String cipherModeName, java.lang.String cipherPadding)
      Creates a new instance that uses a cipher of the given algorithm.
